Description: Wall and foot sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery cup or bowl; interior black; exterior black with reserved band at junction with ring foot; foot black save reserved resting surface; underside: reserved with wide black band, black line and central black dot; inscription incised on underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Compare Athenian Agora, vol XII, no. 540 (possibly similar in shape).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1540)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
